title: How to Build Muscle on Your Legs Without Weights

steps.title: Lower your upper body and bottom for a few seconds.
steps.content: Lower your upper body and bottom for a few seconds. Stand up straight with both feet around shoulder-width apart. Shift your weight to your heels, and sink yourself into a squat. Hinge your hips so you lean slightly forward, and lower yourself until your thighs are completely parallel to the floor. Then, stand up straight again. [1] X Research source Squats are a great way to strengthen your hips and lower body. [2] X Expert Source Pete Cerqua Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 14 May 2020.

steps.title: Hold your squat for longer.
steps.content: Hold your squat for longer. Squat down low, so your bottom is about 1 ft (30 cm) or so above the ground. Hold this position for at least 5 seconds before standing upright again. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Take your traditional squats to the next level.
steps.content: Take your traditional squats to the next level. Rest your hands behind your head and arrange your feet so they’re a little wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower yourself into a squat, and then leap as high as you can into the air. Land on the ground in a squat, and repeat the exercise. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Switch between both legs during this exercise.
steps.content: Switch between both legs during this exercise. Take a step forward with your right leg, lunging forward until your right thigh is completely parallel to the ground. Then, return to an upright position. Repeat the exercise, this time lunging with your left leg. [5] X Research source Don’t push your knee over your toes when you lunge.

steps.title: Lunge to the left and right instead of lunging forward.
steps.content: Lunge to the left and right instead of lunging forward. Take a large step to your left. Shift your body weight to the left, and then stand up straight. Repeat the exercise by stepping and lunging to the right. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Step on and off a sturdy bench or box.
steps.content: Step on and off a sturdy bench or box. Place your right foot on the box, leaving your left foot on the ground. Then, push with your right foot and jump in the air. Alternate your legs so your left foot lands on the box, and your right foot lands on the ground. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Prepare to hop nonstop for this exercise.
steps.content: Prepare to hop nonstop for this exercise. Place a sturdy chair in front of you. Then, jump so your left foot can comfortably tap the edge of the chair seat. Jump again, this time tapping the seat with your right foot. Keep alternating between both legs as you continue the exercise. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Try this exercise on a comfortable surface or yoga mat.
steps.content: Try this exercise on a comfortable surface or yoga mat. Lie on your side, with both legs stacked on top of one another. Lift and lower the top leg slowly, creating a 45-degree angle between your legs as you go. Then, switch positions and repeat the exercise with your opposite leg. [9] X Research source

steps.title: This exercise requires a little extra balance.
steps.content: This exercise requires a little extra balance. Stand on your right leg, with your left leg raised and bent in the air. Tighten your core and lift yourself onto the right ball of your foot. Hold this pose for 3 seconds, and then switch legs. [10] X Research source You can also stand on a step or a block of wood to do this exercise. [11] X Expert Source Pete Cerqua Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 14 May 2020. Single-leg calf raises also strengthen your Achilles tendon. [12] X Expert Source Pete Cerqua Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 14 May 2020.
